subject: Philosophy
title: Greek Philosophy and Modern Science
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Greek Philosophy and Modern Science.

hook.text: Every time a scientist forms a hypothesis and tests it, they're following a tradition the Greeks invented.

buildup.text: The Greeks separated observation from myth, created logic, and asked whether nature follows laws.

discovery.text: Aristotle classified animals. Euclid systematized geometry. Archimedes discovered physical laws. Science has Greek DNA.

twist.text: The Greeks also got much wrong. They trusted reason over experiment, leading to centuries of errors.

climax.text: Modern science combined Greek rationalism with empirical testing ‚Äî the best of both approaches.

punchline.text: Science stands on shoulders that wore togas.

quiz.question: What did the Greeks contribute to the foundation of modern science?
options: Rational inquiry, logic, and systematic classification of nature
